title: NewsCO.com.au – India v Australia: Virat Kohli says only some of the Aussies have lost his friendship after spiteful series
text:
Smith shows class amid Australia’s series loss to India 
Virat Kohli has moved to clarify comments he made in the aftermath of the spiteful Test series between India and Australia. 
Before the series, Kohli told reporters he was “really good friends” with some of the Australian players, but after four Tests of allegations, accusations and fiery encounters, the Indian skipper said he changed his mind. 
“I thought that was the case, but it has changed for sure,” Kohli said. 
“I’ve been proven wrong.” 
Kohli’s comments at the time came in direct contrast to Australian captain Steve Smith’s, who apologised for some of his behaviour in the heat of battle. 
But on Twitter, Kohli now says his comments were “blown way out of proportion” — turns out he has only defriended part of the Australian team.
